title: Sleepaway Camp
review: Somehow this still makes American kids summer camps look really fun, especially in the 70s and 80s. So what if the innocent men's shorts were too short, and the guilty men shouldn't be allowed anywhere close to a camp? So what if there's a series of horrible killings, and the kids are allowed to watch the body bags get loaded into a truck? They had water balloon fights and played capture the flag! It's the kind of movie I've seen referenced and parodied many a time, except for...
spoilers: The sudden and crazy ending! This alone makes it worth a watch. In a way, if the rest wasn't so cheesy, the ending might not have had the same impact. Also, I can't not mention the bizarre performance of the mother character. That was certainly a choice. I thought it was the strangest thing about the film by far, right up until the ending.
